title: Reharmonization in Music Quiz
description: Test your understanding of reharmonization techniques and their purpose in music.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of reharmonization in music?

options.text: To change the melody of a song completely.
To alter the harmonic progression of a piece while retaining the original or a closely related melody.
To adjust the tempo and rhythm of a composition without changing chords.
To transpose a song to a different key without altering its harmonic structure.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common technique used in reharmonization?

options.text: Strictly adhering to the original chord voicings without alteration.
Employing tritone substitution, where a dominant 7th chord is replaced by another dominant 7th chord a tritone away.
Reducing all complex chords to simple triads.
Changing the time signature of a piece from 4/4 to 3/4.

questions.question: Reharmonization is solely about making a piece sound more complex and dissonant.
If a G7 chord (V7 in C major) is reharmonized using a tritone substitution, which dominant 7th chord would typically replace it?
What is a common artistic goal of reharmonization?

options.text: To simplify the harmonic structure for beginner musicians.
To create fresh interest, add harmonic color, or update an older piece with new harmonic possibilities.
To ensure the song can only be played in its original, published form.
To make the song shorter in duration by cutting out harmonic sections.
